benchmark_details.name: MIR (Multi-Image Reasoning)
benchmark_details.overview: MIR is a novel benchmark for multi-image interleaved reasoning that enhances MLLMs' ability to comprehend complex relationships between multiple images and their corresponding interleaved textual contexts. It includes structured reasoning steps to guide reasoning processes.

purpose_and_intended_users.goal: To evaluate and enhance Multi-modal Large Language Models' reasoning capabilities over multi-image interleaved data.

data.source: Combination of original recordings, publicly accessible content from short-video platforms, and educational resources from open-access platforms.

methodology.calculation: Evaluation based on modelâ€™s performance across multiple benchmarks using statistical measures.
methodology.interpretation: Performance is evaluated based on the ability of models to answer multi-image reasoning questions correctly.
methodology.validation: Extensive experiments on multiple models to ensure reliability.

ethical_and_legal_considerations.privacy_and_anonymity: All collected data undergoes a rigorous multi-stage review process, ensuring sensitive materials are filtered out.
ethical_and_legal_considerations.data_licensing: Proper authorization and usage rights secured during data collection.
